references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, which is the foundation for the proposed method and a cornerstone of many of the related works discussed.

references.paper_title: Texts as images in prompt tuning for multi-label image recognition
references.reason: This paper proposes the TaI-DPT method, which is directly compared against and synergistically combined with the proposed method, showcasing its importance in the field.

references.paper_title: Dualcoop: Fast adaptation to multi-label recognition with limited annotations
references.reason: The DualCoOp method is another key related work, directly compared against, and the proposed method shows improvements when combined with it, highlighting its relevance.
This paper provides foundational cognitive neuroscience context, informing the design of the class concept representation, demonstrating its foundational importance to the core approach.

references.paper_title: Microsoft coco: Common objects in context
references.reason: The MS-COCO dataset is a primary benchmark dataset used for evaluation, showing its importance in establishing the practical relevance and performance of the proposed method.
